intro: Commiphora obovata, commonly known as the African frankincense tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and obovate leaves. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been historically used for incense and medicinal purposes. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soils. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
